body:
On Dec 12, 2014 11:48 AM, "Russ Cox" <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> If git-review is being used from github.com, just print an error and
exit. Don't work around it. Make people do the right thing.
Github is the official mirror, why can't people clone from github? There
are legitimate reasons, for example, in certain cases, the googlesource
connection might be blocked or too slow and the user will need a proxy to
get to that, requiring each pull to use googlesource might not be ideal if
the user only occasionally send a CL but wants to track the development
closely.

Besides, supporting github as origin really doesn't make git-review more
complex, it can hard code two possible origins and check for that. When
pushing, use the correct URL instead of origin. It does make the life
easier for users in certain areas.
